Judge overturns drug — and gun — convictions as lab scandal impact widens

The guilty pleas vacated may be one of the first cases in which problems with drug evidence impacted more than the drug charges against a defendant. (Globe, 11:52 a.m.)

Man charged with trying to poison dogs

Kenneth Hyland of Everett was arraigned this morning on charges that he attempted to poison dogs by dropping antifreeze-soaked hot dogs on a lawn. (Globe, 12:16 p.m.)

Warren defends asbestos lawsuit work, comments on Mass. ballot questions

Democratic Senate candidate Elizabeth Warren defended her past representation of an insurance company, and indicated tentative support for medical marijuana and physician-assisted suicide. (Globe, 10:56 a.m.)

NYC schools offer morning-after pills

The New York City Department of Education is making Plan B emergency contraception available to some high school girls as young as 14 years old. (AP, 10:21 a.m.)

After a night of incompetent officiating, the Patriots blew a 30-21 fourth-quarter lead to the Ravens on a questionable buzzer-beating 27-yard field goal.
